title: India v Australia: Women’s Cricket World Cup semi-final – live
summary: The second semi-final in Navi Mumbai features a match between the co-hosts and the defending champions. Live updates will be provided by our writers throughout the game. Follow along for insights and key moments.

title: No 10 refuses to say if PM’s ethics adviser saw proof that Reeves was wrongly advised over home rental – UK politics live
summary: Reeves has been renting her South London home without obtaining the necessary £945 licence from the local council. This oversight may lead to potential penalties or legal issues. The council emphasizes the importance of compliance for rental properties.

title: Prayers for a Hungry Ghost review – a monster take on family trauma
summary: Elisabeth Gunawan's mythological horror combines puppetry, dance, theatre, and film to delve into the emotional impacts of a family's move from Hong Kong to the United States. The work creatively intertwines various artistic forms to reflect on themes of dislocation and identity. Through this innovative approach, Gunawan highlights the complex experiences associated with migration.

title: Dutch centrists D66 back in lead in election vote count, edging past far-right PVV – Europe live
summary: Rob Jetten's party has taken the lead in the election with a margin of 15,122 votes. This puts them in a prime position to initiate discussions on forming the next government. The party's strong performance suggests a significant shift in the political landscape.

title: No 10 refuses to say it has seen evidence to show Reeves did not break ministerial code
summary: Pressure is increasing on the chancellor following an "inadvertent" mistake involving the rental of a London home. Despite the Prime Minister stating that an apology is enough, criticism persists. The situation raises questions about accountability and transparency in leadership.
